meaningMnemonic: If you shoot a tall stalk of <radical>beans</radical> with an <radical>arrow</radical>, the bean plant will go from tall to <kanji>short</kanji>. When the beans are hit with that arrow, it severs the plant in two, and you are left with a stalk of beans that is much shorter than before.
readingMnemonic: All this shooting of arrows to make the bean plants more short is taking a long time. Since you’re out in the sun, you’re starting to get a <reading>tan</reading> (たん). After the day is finally over, your tan is really, really dark.
